config.question: In which part of the Americas did the Anasazi live?

answer_3.response: Chaco Canyon on the San Juan River in present-day New Mexico was the heart of Anasazi culture. The Anasazi built massive pueblo villages and overcame the aridity of their desert homes by developing a complex society that could sustain a huge technologically sophisticated network of irrigation canals.
